The Roman life was essentially an outgrowth of the old pa- triarchal form of goremment Abraham finds his counterpart in Anchises. lt was the paterfamilias that was aud continued to be the man of power. While the Greek father could only banish his child from his home. and refuse him the protection of the family name and arms, and could not affect his liberty or his life, the Roman father was the absolute master, and held the powers of life aud death. His power was almost more unlimited than that of the Eastern despot over his subjecta. In his own home (domus) he was the absolute master (dominus). And yet his power was restricted.
